chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J. Dupleasis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court adopts proposed supervision plan on PSI.
Eligible for programming after 9 years.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Plea Hearing on 2/10/2015 before Judge Michael Moran 
INCLUDES 13CF756, 13CF510, 14CF1065, AND 15CF126

Case Called: 
1:39 pm
Includes 13CF510, 13CF756, 14CF1065, 15CF126.
Clerk: Kassidi
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence and ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in custody and with Atty Jay Kronenwetter.
Atty Kronenwetter states that he went over the PSI with the Defendant.
State notes that corrections were made to the PSI- 14CF1065 charges should be Dismissed Outright and not Dismissed but Read In.
State notes other corrections to be made on the PSI on the record. 
Parties to proceed to sentencing arguments. 
State gives sentencing arguments. Defense gives sentencing arguments. 

COURT ORDERS: 
13CF756:
Ct. 1 (Buglary-Armed w/Dangerous Weapon-Repeater-PTAC)>> 12 years WSPS- 8 yrs IC and 4 yrs ES. Concurrent to each other. 263 days credit on each Count, concurrent. COURT adpots proposed Supervision plan in PSI. Eligible for programming after 9 years incarcerated. 

Ct. 3 (Armed Robbery with Threat of Force-PTAC-Repeater)>> 22 years WSPS- 12 year IC and 10 ES. Concurrent to each other. 263 days credit on each Count, concurrent. COURT adpots proposed Supervision plan in PSI. Eligible for programming after 9 years incarcerated. 


Ct. 4 (Felon Possess Firearm-Repeater)>>  9 years WSPS - 5 years IC and 4 years ES. Concurrent to each other. 263 days credit on each Count, concurrent. COURT adpots proposed Supervision plan in PSI. Eligible for programming after 9 years incarcerated. 


15CF126:
Ct. 1 (Armed Robbery with Threat of Force-Repeater)>> 22 years WSPS - 12 years IC and 10 years ES. Concurrent to each other. 263 days credit on each Count, concurrent. COURT adpots proposed Supervision plan in PSI. Eligible for programming after 9 years incarcerated. 

Adj: 3:05 pm

DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE WSPS.
to Inspect Juvenile Court Records from Brian Radtke at DOC - APPROVED

Case called: 9:05 am
Clerk: Kassidi
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence and Mike Puerner.
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Jay Kronenwetter.
PRELIM IN 15CF126:  
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves:  
13CF510:
Ct. 1 (Misappropriate ID info-Avoid Penalty-Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 2 (Operate w/o Valid License(3rd w/in yrs)-Repeater))>>DRI

13CF756:
Ct. 2 (Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home, PTAC, Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 5 (False Imprisonment, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, PTAC, Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 6 (False Imprisonment, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, PTAC, Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 7 (Criminal Damage to Property, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, PTAC, Repeater)>>DRI

14CF1065: DRI all charges w/o Predjudice If defendant in compliance with agreement, the case won't be refiled.
Ct. 1 (Armed Robbery with Threat of Force-Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 2 (Felon Possess Firearm-Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 3 (Intentionally Point Firearm at Person-Repeater)>>DRI
Ct. 4 (Carry Concealed Weapon-Repeater)>>DRI

15CF126: Ct. 1 (Armed Robbery with Use of Force) to be Amended to Ct. 1 (Armed Robbery with Threat of Force) - COURT GRANTS. Atty Mike Puerner to file new Information at the end of the day.

PLEA: 
13CF756:
Ct. 1 (Burglary-Armed w/Dangerous Weapon, PTAC, Repeater)>>GUILTY
Ct. 3 (Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, PTAC, Repeater)>>GUILTY
Ct. 4 (Felon Possess Firearm-Repeater)>>GUILTY

15CF126:
Ct. 1 (Armed Robbery with Threat of Force-Repeater)>>GUILTY
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  
COURT ORDERS: PSI ordered within 60 days and COURT wants copy 10 days before sentencing. 
DATES: Sentencing date to be set with JA
Bond Continues.
Adj: 9:34 am

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
INCLUDES 15CF126, 14CF1065, 13CF756, 13CF510.    Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Absolute sobriety.  No contact with victim(s):  N.L., P.H., R.D.,  co-defendants: A.A., R.O., K.W., & E.G.    Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.
No possession of a controlled substance without valid prescription.
